name: patchiness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of only existing or happening in some parts or situations: The problem is the patchiness of the data.
the quality of being sometimes good and sometimes bad: The beauty of the staging cannot make up for the patchiness of the writing. See
patchy
More examplesFewer examplesHas tree cover always been patchy in this area or is the patchiness a sign of trouble?The answer to this patchiness in the application of the law is not to change the law. This partly explains the patchiness in countries' technological achievements overall. For all the patchiness of his recent work, there is still no one else like him.No one could deny the patchiness of Manchester United's performance.
